titleStmt.title: Judicium discretionis, or, A just and necessary apology, for the peoples judgement of private discretion exhibited against the arrogant pretences and imperious suggestions of Tannerus, Valentia, Bellarmine, with other advocates of the papal tyranny, and the tendred to the consideration of all those, who would secure themselves against antichristian impostures and delusions.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, Thomas.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Wilson by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library.
